attributes.action: Force the Prime Minister to resign and call a general election immediately
attributes.additional_details:
Since the new Chancellor of the Exchequer, Kwasi Kwarteng, announced a raft of economic policies, the sterling has been in free fall, and the government borrowing cost has been rising. 

Despite all that has been happening in the markets - which has real implications for people's finances - the new PM is not willing to change the policies. 

The new PM is leading the country in the wrong direction, and I am calling parliament to force her to resign and call for a general election immediately.
attributes.background: The new Prime Minister has just been in Power for about 36 days and based on her policies, the Sterling has already hit an all-time low, the cost of borrowing for the UK government is climbing but the Prime Minister is doubling down on her policies even though the numbers don't add up.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for Ministers to be sacked or resign.

You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/619781

The Petitions Committee has scheduled a debate on the above petition for Monday 17 October. You can watch this here from 4.30pm: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qMHQNKdbu-Q&list=PLj3mInRJqIemzke3yWcmPaR5ZTW4S4bur&index=1
